Operation 'getCustomerServiceMetric' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, poor_ai_interpretability. Missing summary entirely. Description is verbose and lacks clarity on what data is returned. AI agents need to understand: (1) this retrieves performance metrics with peer comparison, (2) required parameters and their purpose, (3) what the response contains (metric rating, benchmark, peer group comparison). Improved version is more concise and action-oriented while maintaining domain terminology like 'peer benchmarking' and 'metric rating'.

data.current_description:
Use this method to retrieve a seller's performance and rating for the customer service metric.

Control the response from the getCustomerServiceMetric method using the following path and query parameters:
  • customer_service_metric_type controls the type of customer service transactions evaluated for the metric rating.
  • evaluation_type controls the period you want to review.
  • evaluation_marketplace_id specifies the target marketplace for the evaluation.
Currently, metric data is returned for only peer benchmarking. For details on the workings of peer benchmarking, see Service metrics policy.

For details on using and understanding the response from this method, see Interpreting customer service metric ratings.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve seller customer service metric and benchmark
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the authenticated seller's customer service performance metric and peer benchmark data for a specified metric type and evaluation period. Required parameters: customer_service_metric_type (the type of customer service transactions to evaluate), evaluation_type (the time period for evaluation), and evaluation_marketplace_id (target marketplace). Returns the seller's metric rating, benchmark average for their peer group, and evaluation cycle dates. Metric data uses peer benchmarking to compare seller performance against similar sellers in the same peer group.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description is verbose and lacks clarity on what data is returned. AI agents need to understand: (1) this retrieves performance metrics with peer comparison, (2) required parameters and their purpose, (3) what the response contains (metric rating, benchmark, peer group comparison). Improved version is more concise and action-oriented while maintaining domain terminology like 'peer benchmarking' and 'metric rating'.

message: Operation 'findSellerStandardsProfiles' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description explains what a standards profile is but doesn't clearly state what the response contains (array of profiles). Added explicit mention that response is an array of profiles and clarified cycle values (CURRENT/PROJECTED) for better AI agent understanding of available data.

data.current_description:
This call retrieves all the standards profiles for the associated seller.

A standards profile is a set of eBay seller metrics and the seller's associated compliance values (either TOP_RATED, ABOVE_STANDARD, or BELOW_STANDARD).

A seller's multiple profiles are distinguished by two criteria, a "program" and a "cycle." A profile's program is one of three regions where the seller may have done business, or PROGRAM_GLOBAL to indicate all marketplaces where the seller has done business. The cycle value specifies whether the standards compliance values were determined at the last official eBay evaluation or at the time of the request.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all standards profiles for the authenticated seller. Each standards profile contains eBay seller metrics and compliance ratings (TOP_RATED, ABOVE_STANDARD, or BELOW_STANDARD). Profiles are distinguished by program (regional marketplace or PROGRAM_GLOBAL for all marketplaces) and cycle (CURRENT for last official eBay evaluation or PROJECTED for current time). Returns an array of all applicable standards profiles for the seller across different programs and cycles.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description explains what a standards profile is but doesn't clearly state what the response contains (array of profiles). Added explicit mention that response is an array of profiles and clarified cycle values (CURRENT/PROJECTED) for better AI agent understanding of available data.

Description lacks clarity on: (1) what the 4 parameters are and their purpose, (2) the exact structure/format of returned data. Improved version adds context about parameter availability and clarifies that this is for analyzing listing performance. Added actionable context about use case to help AI agents determine when to call this operation.

data.current_description:
This method returns a report that details the user traffic received by a seller's listings.

A traffic report gives sellers the ability to review how often their listings appeared on eBay, how many times their listings are viewed, and how many purchases were made. The report also returns the report's start and end dates, and the date the information was last updated.

For more information, see Traffic report details
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve seller listing traffic and engagement metrics
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a traffic report detailing buyer engagement with the authenticated seller's listings. The report includes metrics on listing impressions (how often listings appeared), listing views (number of times viewed), and purchase conversions (number of purchases made). Accepts optional query parameters to filter or customize the report (4 parameters available). Returns report data with start and end dates for the reporting period and the timestamp of the last data update. Use this report to analyze listing performance and buyer engagement patterns.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks clarity on: (1) what the 4 parameters are and their purpose, (2) the exact structure/format of returned data. Improved version adds context about parameter availability and clarifies that this is for analyzing listing performance. Added actionable context about use case to help AI agents determine when to call this operation.
